content.description:
P1: Climb up the white slab left of the falls, running out the easy climbing on polished holds. Break left at a vertical headwall and climb up to a good ledge with a tree for the anchor.  

  P2: Nice easy long scramble potentially cris-crossing the falls to get up to another good big ledge with a pool of water at the base of the last pitch. 

  P3: Pick your way to the top. Rock up here is loose and unprotected.
content.protection: Alpine type rack, with small nuts.
content.location: The route starts at the very popular base of the falls. Once you top out, hike off climbers left into the woods to meet back up with the hiking trail for the descent.

content.description: The very scenic roaring brook falls, known for its ice climb, also has an adventurous rock route that is possible late season as the water level drops down.
